title: Georgy Grammatikopulo
text:
Georgy Savvich Grammatikopulo (; 1930, <a href="Sukhumi">Sukhumi</a> – 1992) was a <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> player. A native of <a href="Sukhumi">Sukhumi</a>, <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgia</a>, Grammatikopulo played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>.
He started his professional football career at <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Tbilisi">FC Dinamo Tbilisi</a> during the <a href="1949%20Soviet%20Top%20League">1949 season</a>. He then joined <a href="Spartak%20Tbilisi">Spartak Tbilisi</a>, however, after he only had three appearances during the whole season, he joined <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Saint%20Petersburg">Dynamo Leningrad</a> in 1952. In the <a href="1954%20Soviet%20Top%20League">1954 season</a>, Grammatikopulo was hired by <a href="Dynamo%20Kiev">Dynamo Kiev</a>, where he spent the next five years. After a short return to Dinamo Tbilisi in 1960, he joined <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Sukhumi">FC Dinamo Sukhumi</a> in his hometown of <a href="Sukhumi">Sukhumi</a>. He retired in 1962.
In 1956 Voinov played couple of games for the <a href="Ukraine%20national%20football%20team">Ukraine</a> at the Spartakiad of the Peoples of the USSR.
In 1992, after the dissolution of the Soviet Union, Grammatikopulo died.
